channel.title: When i start a server
channel.description:
ok so i have been port fowarding for the last hour and the port is open but when i launch the server it starts the server on ip address 0.0.0.0 which leads em to believe that something is wrong... to further prove this it says "error connection to server" when other people try to connect via my no-ip.org name. Oh ya, i am using wireless.
So based off the information that i gave you, what am i doing wrong? Why is it starting on ip address 0.0.0.0? How can i fix this? _____________________________________________________________________________________________________ OK i have jsut found out that this is a TESTSCAPE only bug, although if you would still be nice enough to post an tell me ho to change it so that it stops launching the server to the ip 0.0.0.0 i would appreciate it, thanks
[img]http://i425.photobucket.com/albums/pp340/adinofaries/jtyktyktyk-1.jpg[/img]

item.title: When i start a server
item.dc:creator: @Axed Axed
item.description:
@Axed wrote:

All you need to do is portfoward.

Read full topic

item.title: When i start a server
item.dc:creator: @abcNoob abcNoob
item.description:
@abcNoob wrote:

NO-IP’s DUC doesn’t mask the IP address. People can still find it. They can find it by looking up the IP address using some kind of tool called whois.

I see that you got that crap Windows Vista.

Read full topic

item.title: When i start a server
item.dc:creator: @webber webber
item.description:
@webber wrote:

You are currently running the server on local host so therefore only you can connect to it via 127.0.0.1/0.0.0.0/localhost or nothing at all. If you have port forwarded to allow others to connect then they should be able to connect on your actual IP address. If you do not want them to use your IP you could mask the IP address via no-ip.com’s duc. There’s a few tutorials on no-ip and port-forwarding scattered around the forums. Just take a look, as they may just help you.

Read full topic

item.title: When i start a server
item.dc:creator: @coco_zezima coco zezima
item.description:
@coco_zezima wrote:

Thats the ip you want to use
thats the default ip unless it was changed.
If you want to change go into server file and push ctrl + f and search 0.0.0.0
Now change it to what u want

Read full topic
